name: Halo Smart IoT
detail:
Work project using Flutter. 
Home screen: Listview of devices connected to a gateway. Device cards can be reordered and filtered. Allows the user to rename, delete and add alarms to devices.
Graph screen: Flutter ECharts library was used to make sure there is cohension with the web version of the app as they used Apache ECharts.
Add/remove device screen: Displays images/gifs to help the user add/remove devices to the gateway.
Settings page: Uses shared preferences to save user preferences locally to the device.
Overview page: Uses pluto_grid to display an overview of user's gateway information.
Push notifications via firebase.
Dio/retrofit for APIs/backend.
CI/CD using Gitlab Runner and Fastlane.
State management via Provider/ChangeNotifier.

name: Halo for Niagara 4
detail:
Work project using Flutter.
Connects to a Halo Gateway and checks what sensors have been added to the gateway.
It displays the connectivity level of sensors.

name: IHP Install
detail:
Work project using Flutter.
Functionality includes displaying videos based on the guide selected and a commisioning screen.
Commisioning screen takes user input about the commisioned job and emails it to the selected email.

name: Simaxx Mobile
detail:
Work project which used Flutter.
More of a proof-of-concept to show Flutter capabilities so that my company would use Flutter going forwards.
Basic project which integrates a WebView connecting to the Simaxx platform whilst saving user details.

name: SSB Ironman
detail:
Personal project for practicing using Flutter. 
Provider for state management.
Shared preferences for saving user preferences.
Fairly basic project with a lot of improvements to be made.

name: flutter_learning
detail: Collection of practice projects completed from https://www.udemy.com/course/learn-flutter-dart-to-build-ios-android-apps

name: connor_lee_cv
detail: CV/Portfolio page created using Flutter. The website you are seeing should be this!

name: eBMS / VDE
detail:
eBMS / VDE is an unreleased project.
It was designed to allow video calling between SIP devices.
SIP device information was obtained by connecting to a JACE.

name: eBMS / Alarms
detail:
eBMS / Alarms was a project that allows connection to any Niagara 4 station and receives all the alarms in that station.
It parses Obix data and displays alarms which can be filtered.
It also allows users to acknowledge alarms on that station.
Has onboarding functionality.

name: CrossTalk 3 (Mobile)
detail:
Crosstalk 3 was a project that was currently supported on Windows and our end-user wanted phone functionality.
Design based on our designer.
Takes API data from the Crosstalk 3 project and displays it on the phone.
Includes notifications when fire alarms occur.
Allows silencing and reseting fire panels from the phone.

name: eBMS / Mobile
detail:
Primarily bug fixes and improvements.
This app had a lot of aging code and libraries that were no longer maintained. It was updated to work with newer versions of Android and run with newer versions of Niagara as well.

name: eBMS / TouchView
detail:
Primarily bug fixes and improvements. 
This app was designed to run on a tablet 24/7 and it had a major issue with memory leaks.
This was fixed using Leakcanary and Crashlytics to see what was causing the memory leaks.

name: Weather App (Android)
detail:
Written in Java using Android Studio.
Displays weather results based on the user's chosen city.
Uses OpenWeatherMap API to retrieve JSON files containing weather information.
Moshi/gson library is used to read JSON files as objects.
Volley is used to grab data from the API.

name: Weather App (iOS)
detail:
Personal project for practicing using Swift and Xcode. 
It uses OpenweatherMap API for the weather data. 
It has a list view and a detail view for the city chosen by the user.

name: practice_projects_ios
detail: Collection of practice projects completed from HackingWithSwift.

name: Weather Systems (GL)
detail:
Written in C++ using Visual Studio.
This project was part of my dissertation. The aim was to create a weather system that interacts and changes a virtual environment.
Uses OpenGL library.
Features rain/snow weather, and a day/night system.

name: 2D Game Engine
detail:
Written in C++ using Visual Studio. 
Features two levels in which the player can move their character around and fire projectiles at enemies.
The SFML library contains the core functionality which is extended with multiple subsystems such as resource, audio, and input managers.
